children.text: When Custom Leaderboard is read, use a loop to pick objects and set its text.

actions.text: Set the Texts and Rank of Current Saved User
If Current User is not on Leaderboard, 0 will be returned as the rank
Set Text to Database.readLeaderboard( Read-ID , KeyName , LoopIndex ) for each object

children.text: Highlight the Data of the Current Saved User if User is on Leaderboard

children.name: SEP
children.comment: This is the Data Separator for my Database Write Actions

children.text:
===WITHOUT TIMESTAMP===
If you do not use a Timestamp, if two or more player named same, suppose "Beebot" saves game by using the same name at location "customLeaderboard/Beebot" the previous saves are overwritten.

===WITH TIMESTAMP===
If you use Timestamp, data is saved at "customLeaderboard/[timestamp]". No data will be overwritten now. So there can be 1 or more "Beebots" in the leaderboard.

( Instead of using Name or timestamp, you can also use Email address- which will be unique to each user and choose not to show the Email address in the leaderboard
To understand compare the values stored in the Firebase Console )

actions.text: VIENE DESDE "VIENE_DE=1" VIENE DESDE LA RULETA
VIENE DESDE "VIENE_DE=0" VIENE DESDE EL MENU
